pros: so the pros are: Growth, rewarding, learning, human contact, international, good salary.
cons: Tough for the soul to see other people suffering, and the work never finishes.

review_title: It was a rich experience that i gained through interaction with refugees
pros: you learn the international protection law, UNHCR mandate, and ways of providing assistance to refugees.  Also i was lucky to work on the outreach program where i have worked on mobilizing community support within refugee populations.  I have also conducted more than 150 focus groups on community level where i have learned the vulnerabilities of the refugee population and how to assess their situation and assist them further in a sustainable manner.
cons: The accountability does not exist at UNHCR office in Damascus.  Supervisors or senior staff often make personal relations of friend ship or social gathering to guarantee their status with the higher management.  moreover the senior management consisting of international staff often find ways to twist reports to show the continuous need of refugees in order to guarantee them their jobs in Damascus as they would rather stay in a city with facilities, culture, restaurants and social life than being sent away to a secluded operation.

job_title: Senior Psychosocial Case Worker in Damascus
pros:
Potential for growth 
Constantly learning
Projects are interesting 
During my two years at UNHCR , which was my first job , I learned a lot , met amazing people.
cons:
Big organization that can create a barrier between staff and management , and between staff and people being served.
Bureaucratic, therefore changing an existing policy is very difficult.

review_title: working to assist refugees and help them through interviews, programs and counseling
pros: ?international experience and networking, and ability to work in war time with survivals
cons: follows the political conditions in some areas which don't justifies humanity

pros:
Respect for staff 
Opportunity for international action

nothing to say it was very nice work experience
